itemDescription: Scottish rugby union player, golfer, soccer player and cricketer (1888-1967)

wikipedia_page.main: Kenneth Grant MacLeod (2 February 1888 – 7 March 1967) was a Scottish international rugby union player, as well as a golfer, soccer player and cricketer. He was capped ten times for Scotland between 1905-08.MacLeod was inducted into the Scottish Sports Hall of Fame in March 2010.

response: * K. G. MacLeod (Kenneth Grant MacLeod, 1888–1967), Scottish cricketer

response: * K. G. MacLeod (1911) : K. G. MacLeod (Lancashire)

On a particularly foggy day when it was difficult to see the posts, Findlay was refereeing the match between Oxford University and Cambridge University at the end of the 1907–08 season. The match was tied at the end of the game and the Scots centre K. G. MacLeod, playing for Cambridge, tried a last-gasp drop kick to win the match. Findlay could not see the posts or where the ball went. He asked MacLeod how his kick went. MacLeod replied 'No goal'. He felt the ball swerved just outside.Then Came a Cloud - John W Keddie - Google Books
